name: Atrisco
about: Historic Hispanic neighborhood known for its strong cultural identity, traditional plazas, and deep roots in Albuquerque's past.

name: Barelas
about: Vibrant Hispanic neighborhood with a rich cultural heritage, offering traditional food, art, and a close-knit community feel.

name: University of New Mexico (UNM)
about: Bustling and youthful area centered around the UNM campus. Known for its student energy, eclectic shops, trendy restaurants, and late-night activity.

name: Nob Hill
about: Eclectic and artsy district bordering UNM, featuring independent shops, art galleries, trendy restaurants, and a lively nightlife scene.

name: Downtown Albuquerque
about: Central business district with historic buildings, museums, a mix of restaurants and bars, and a professional crowd. Offers a more urban experience.

name: Huning Highlands
about: Primarily residential area with a mix of established homes and newer developments, known for its peaceful atmosphere and convenient location.

name: Gibson
about: Primarily residential area with a mix of established homes and newer developments, offering a family-friendly environment and convenient access to amenities.

name: Kirtland
about: Established neighborhood with a strong military presence due to its proximity to Kirtland Air Force Base. Offers a structured community feel and attracts government contractors and military families.

name: Sandia Base
about: Neighborhood directly surrounding Kirtland Air Force Base, known for its military families and government employees. Offers a close-knit community atmosphere.

name: Lomas
about: Established residential neighborhood with a mix of apartments and single-family homes, known for its quiet streets and family-oriented atmosphere.

name: Ridgecrest
about: Established residential neighborhood with a mix of apartments and single-family homes, offering a peaceful environment and convenient access to amenities.

name: Academy Acres
about: Upscale neighborhood with newer developments boasting scenic mountain views. Popular with professionals and families seeking a modern feel.

name: High Desert
about: Upscale neighborhood with newer developments featuring stunning vistas. Attracts professionals and families seeking a modern lifestyle with scenic surroundings.

name: Tanoan East
about: Established middle-class neighborhood offering a mix of housing options and convenient access to amenities. Known for its family-friendly atmosphere.

name: Tanoan West
about: Established middle-class neighborhood offering a mix of housing options and convenient access to amenities. Popular with families seeking a comfortable and convenient location.

name: Country Club
about: Established neighborhood near the Country Club of Albuquerque, featuring a mix of apartments and single-family homes. Attracts a diverse demographic, including families and retirees.

name: The Nations
about: Established neighborhood near the Country Club of Albuquerque, featuring a mix of apartments and single-family homes. Offers a peaceful environment with convenient access to amenities.

name: Sandia Heights
about: Upscale neighborhood with breathtaking Sandia Mountain views. Popular with professionals and retirees seeking a tranquil environment with stunning scenery.

name: Altura Northeast
about: Upscale neighborhood with breathtaking Sandia Mountain views. Offers a luxurious living experience and attracts professionals and retirees seeking a peaceful environment.

name: Tramway
about: Outdoor enthusiast's haven offering direct access to the Sandia Peak Tramway and hiking trails in the foothills. Popular with active residents who enjoy mountain recreation.

name: Glenwood Hills
about: Primarily residential neighborhood nestled in the foothills, offering scenic mountain views and close proximity to hiking trails. Attracts outdoor enthusiasts and families seeking a nature-oriented lifestyle.

name: Journal Center
about: Primarily commercial area featuring shopping centers, restaurants, and various businesses. Offers convenient access to amenities for nearby residents.

name: Coors Blvd West
about: Primarily commercial area featuring shopping centers, restaurants, and various businesses. Offers convenient access to amenities for nearby residents.

name: Mesa del Rio
about: Nature lover's paradise with direct access to the Rio Grande bosque trails. Offers a relaxed vibe and attracts outdoorsy residents and families seeking a connection to nature.

name: River West
about: Primarily residential neighborhood with convenient access to the Rio Grande bosque trails. Offers a peaceful environment and attracts residents seeking a nature-oriented lifestyle.

name: Westgate
about: Mix of affordable housing options near Interstate 40, popular with budget-conscious residents and young professionals seeking a convenient location.

name: Valley West
about: Mix of affordable housing options near Interstate 40, popular with budget-conscious residents and young professionals seeking a convenient location.

name: Old Town
about: Albuquerque's historic heart with traditional adobe buildings, shops selling Native American crafts, and museums.

name: North Valley
about: Historic district with agricultural roots and established Hispanic communities. Offers a slower pace of life and is known for its farms and traditional acequias irrigation canals.
